headline: AppLovin demands short-seller CapitalWatch retract 'conspiratorial' report
summary: AppLovin's cease and desist letter to CapitalWatch called the short-seller's accusations of money laundering defamatory and baseless.

headline: Needham Upgrades AppLovin (APP) to Buy on Ecommerce Growth Inflection
summary: AppLovin Corporation (NASDAQ:APP) is one of the AI Stocks in Focus on Wall Street. On January 26, Needham analyst Bernie McTernan upgraded the stock from Hold to Buy with a price target of $700.00. The firm sees ecommerce growth inflection in 2026, with potential for further upside along a trajectory similar to TikTok’s. It noted […]

headline: PATH and APP: Two AI Stocks Worth Buying, But One Stands Stronger
summary: UiPath's push into agentic AI, steady recurring revenue and lower valuation set it apart in a head-to-head with AppLovin's ad-tech momentum.

headline: 2 of Wall Street’s Favorite Stocks for Long-Term Investors and 1 We Brush Off
summary: The stocks in this article have caught Wall Street’s attention in a big way, with price targets implying returns above 20%. But investors should take these forecasts with a grain of salt because analysts typically say nice things about companies so their firms can win business in other product lines like M&A advisory.

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider AppLovin (APP) After Its Strong Multi Year Share Price Run
summary: If you are wondering whether AppLovin’s share price still offers value after a strong multi year run, the key question is how the current price compares with its fundamentals. The stock closed at US$535.44, with a 5.9% decline over the last 7 days, a 25.0% decline over 30 days, a 13.4% decline year to date, but a 56.1% gain over the last year and a very large gain over 3 years. Recent coverage has focused on AppLovin’s role in mobile app marketing and software tools, which helps explain why...
